TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a law firm in GPE . ORG PERSON ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Ambassador PERSON , Head of ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant who , at that time , was the Vice - Chancellor of GPE , brought proceedings under LAW ( Mediengesetz ) against ORG , a limited liability company which is the owner of the DATE “ Format ” , since it had published an article accusing her of corruption . The applicant was represented by counsel in these and the subsequent proceedings .

By judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( PERSON für PERSON ) found that the accusations voiced against the applicant amounted to defamation and ordered PERSON to withdraw the issue of “ Format ” , to publish the judgment and to pay compensation to the applicant . That judgment was upheld by ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) on DATE .

On DATE the applicant requested ORG to impose a fine on ORG under LAW of LAW , arguing that it had not duly published the judgment of DATE . In particular , she claimed that , although the judgment had been published in “ Format ” on DATE , the heading had been incorrect and the publication was smaller and less visible than the incriminated article had been . Subsequently , the applicant filed further identical requests each time a new issue of “ Format ” was published without rectifying these shortcomings .

By decision of DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s requests , finding that the change of heading was irrelevant and that the publication of the judgment was equivalent to the impugned publication in terms of visibility . Upon the applicant ’s appeal ORG quashed the decision on DATE . It considered that the change of heading was indeed misleading and that the judgment had therefore not been duly published as required by LAW . It ordered Verlagsgruppe News to pay the applicant MONEY ( ORG ) .
On DATE GPE ORG granted the applicant ’s requests made after its initial decision of DATE . It ordered PERSON to pay EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the applicant . PERSON appealed against this decision .

On DATE ORG partly granted the appeal , dismissing those of the applicant ’s requests which had been made after the decision of DATE but before the service of the appeal judgment of CARDINAL DATE . Consequently , it reduced the fine to be paid to the applicant .

Throughout the proceedings under LAW of LAW , the courts took their decisions sitting in camera . The applicant did not request a hearing nor did she complain about the lack of a hearing in her appeals .

In cases in which publication of a judgment has been ordered but has not been duly and/or timely complied with , LAW of LAW provides that the court shall , upon the claimant ’s request and after having heard the media owner , impose a fine on the latter which is payable to the claimant .
LAW does not provide for the holding of hearings in proceedings concerning the imposition of fines . The courts’ practise is to take decisions under LAW of LAW in camera .

In the light of the ORG ’s PERSON v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions DATE ) ORG found in a judgment of DATE ( CARDINAL ) that the relevant provision , namely section QUANTITY of LAW , which required the courts to hear the claimant but was silent as regards the holding of a public hearing , had to be interpreted in conformity with the requirements of LAW . The courts were therefore required to hold a public hearing . In a judgment of DATE ( G CARDINAL ) ORG confirmed that such an interpretation of section QUANTITY of LAW was in conformity with the constitution .
